Module lanej.schedulingsystem
Package lanej.schedulingsystem.helper

Class TimeUtility

java.lang.Object
lanej.schedulingsystem.helper.TimeUtility
public abstract class TimeUtility extends Object
Provides utility methods for time-based operations and checks. This class handles various time manipulations, calculations, and verifications.

  • Method Details

    • createLocalTime

      public static LocalTime createLocalTime(int hour, int minute, String timePeriod)
      Creates a LocalTime instance from given hour, minute, and time period (AM/PM).
      Parameters:
      hour - the hour, from 1 to 12.
      minute - the minute, from 0 to 59.
      timePeriod - "AM" or "PM".
      Returns:
      LocalTime instance corresponding to the input parameters.

    • shortHour

      public static int shortHour(LocalTime time)
      Returns the 12-hour format of the given LocalTime.
      Parameters:
      time - the LocalTime instance.
      Returns:
      hour value in 12-hour format.

    • amOrPm

      public static String amOrPm(LocalTime time)
      Returns "AM" or "PM" based on the given LocalTime.
      Parameters:
      time - the LocalTime instance.
      Returns:
      "AM" or "PM" string.

    • detectOverlap

      public static boolean detectOverlap(LocalDateTime dateTimeOneStart, LocalDateTime dateTimeOneEnd, LocalDateTime dateTimeTwoStart, LocalDateTime dateTimeTwoEnd)
      Detects if two time intervals overlap.
      Parameters:
      dateTimeOneStart - start time of first interval.
      dateTimeOneEnd - end time of first interval.
      dateTimeTwoStart - start time of second interval.
      dateTimeTwoEnd - end time of second interval.
      Returns:
      true if the intervals overlap, false otherwise.

    • detectIfWithinWorkHours

      public static boolean detectIfWithinWorkHours(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end)
      Checks if the given time interval falls within regular working hours. The working hours are between 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM in Eastern Time.
      Parameters:
      start - start time of the interval.
      end - end time of the interval.
      Returns:
      true if the interval is within working hours, false otherwise.
